programs.description: The Business Department teaches students both theories and methods, as well as the broader social and historical perspectives of business practices in accounting, finance, marketing, and management.

courses: Economics 290 Statistical Analysis for Economics OR Mathematics 211 Applied Statistics for the Formal & Natural Sciences
Math 115 Applied Calculus, 116 Calculus with Business Applications or 122 Integral Calculus

Two courses from one of the following areas and one course from one of the remaining areas: a. Accounting b. Finance c. Management d. Marketing e. Business 481 Business Ethics and Social Responsibility f. Business 483 Advanced International Business Cases g. Business 484 Social Impact of Business in South Africa
Recommended: Business 460 Internship; Philosophy 210 Logic; Computer Science 141 Computer Science I, 142 Computer Science II; Media Studies 240 Public Speaking
Economics 290 Statistical Analysis for Economics and Business OR Mathematics 211 Applied Statistics for the Formal & Natural Sciences

requirements: Meet requirements for a major in Business.
A substantial research paper in an area of special interest to the candidate.
An oral examination on the research paper.
All honors students must meet eligibility criteria established for the Honors Program.
